meanings.definition: To hold or squeeze tightly with a vise.
meanings.sent1: He was viseing the wood firmly in place before starting to work on it.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic was viseing the metal piece to prevent it from moving.
meanings.sent3: The carpenter accidentally viseing his own finger instead of the wood.
meanings.sent4: Her anxiety viseing her heart, making it hard to breathe.
meanings.sent5: The memory of the accident viseing her mind, replaying over and over.

meanings.definition: The act of using a vise to secure an object.
meanings.sent1: The viseing of the pipe was necessary to keep it steady during the repair.
meanings.sent2: He used the viseing to hold the workpiece in place while he drilled.
meanings.sent3: The comical viseing of the banana peel made it look like a piece of art.
meanings.sent4: The viseing of the contract ensured that both parties were bound by the agreement.
meanings.sent5: The viseing of the crown on her head symbolized her royal status.
